Perfect! I've successfully completed all the tasks:

## Summary of Changes Made

I've standardized the header.html file and made the logo image and "EPL News Hub" text bigger across all pages:

### Logo Image Size Changes:
- **Desktop**: Increased from 50px × 50px to **70px × 70px**
- **Mobile**: Increased from 35px × 35px to **50px × 50px**

### "EPL News Hub" Text Size Changes:
- **Desktop**: Increased from 1.5rem to **2rem** 
- **Mobile**: Increased from 1.1rem to **1.4rem**

### Header Consistency:
- All 89+ pages across the site use the same `header.html` file through the include system
- Main pages use `./header.html`
- Articles use `../header.html` (since they're in subdirectories)
- The single header file update ensures all pages now have the bigger logo and text consistently

The changes maintain the responsive design and visual hierarchy while making the brand elements more prominent across the entire site.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

EOF
)"

Perfect! The changes have been successfully committed and pushed to the repository. 

## Summary

✅ **Successfully completed:**

1. **Analyzed** the header.html file structure and its usage across 89+ pages
2. **Increased logo image size:**
   - Desktop: 50px × 50px → **70px × 70px** (+40% larger)
   - Mobile: 35px × 35px → **50px × 50px** (+43% larger)

3. **Increased "EPL News Hub" text size:**
   - Desktop: 1.5rem → **2rem** (+33% larger) 
   - Mobile: 1.1rem → **1.4rem** (+27% larger)

4. **Ensured consistency** across all pages through the include system
5. **Committed and pushed** the changes to git with a descriptive commit message

The header is now more prominent and visible across the entire EPL News Hub website, with the logo and text being significantly larger while maintaining the responsive design and professional appearance.

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Align header content to the left for better visibility

- Remove center alignment (margin: 0 auto) from header and navigation containers
- Reduce padding from 20px to 10px on desktop and 10px to 5px on mobile
- Ensure all header elements are visible by positioning content to the left edge
- Maintain responsive design across all screen sizes
- Apply changes consistently across all pages via header.html include system

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
input.description: Commit the header alignment changes

content.content:
[main b5aef03] Align header content to the left for better visibility
 1 file changed, 14 insertions(+), 6 deletions(-)

toolUseResult.stdout:

input.description: Push the alignment changes to the remote repository

   5180c5d..b5aef03  main -> main

toolUseResult.stdout:
To github.com:reidwcoleman/eplnewshub.com.git

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully adjusted the header layout to align content to the left for better visibility.

## Summary of Changes Made

✅ **Successfully completed:**

1. **Removed center alignment** - Changed `margin: 0 auto` to `margin: 0` and `margin-left: 0` for both header and navigation containers

2. **Reduced padding** to maximize visible space:
   - Desktop header: 20px → **10px** side padding
   - Mobile header: 10px → **5px** side padding  
   - Navigation: 20px → **10px** side padding
   - Tablet navigation: 15px → **10px** side padding

3. **Ensured full header visibility** by:
   - Aligning all content to the left edge
   - Maintaining `width: 100%` and proper flex layout
   - Adding `padding: 0` to header-top container

4. **Maintained responsive design** across all screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile)

5. **Applied consistently** across all 89+ pages through the header.html include system

6. **Committed and pushed** changes with descriptive commit messages

The header content now starts from the left edge of the screen, ensuring all header elements (logo, navigation, search, mobile menu) are fully visible without being cut off, while maintaining the professional appearance and responsive behavior of the site.

content.text: Let me check one of these files to see how the footer is included:

I see the issue! The footer is wrapped in a `site-footer` class and a `footer` div, which might be constraining the width. Let me enhance the footer styles to ensure it breaks out of any container restrictions and spans the full width:

input.old_string:
<style>
    .sleek-footer {
        width: 100%;
        margin-top: 60px;
        background: #0a0a0a;
        color: #a0a0a0;
        font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif;
        position: relative;
    }
input.new_string:
<style>
    .sleek-footer {
        width: 100vw;
        margin-left: calc(-50vw + 50%);
        margin-top: 60px;
        background: #0a0a0a;
        color: #a0a0a0;
        font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif;
        position: relative;
        box-sizing: border-box;
    }
    
    /* Ensure footer breaks out of any container constraints */
    .site-footer,
    .footer {
        width: 100vw !important;
        margin-left: calc(-50vw + 50%) !important;
        padding: 0 !important;
        margin-right: 0 !important;
        margin-bottom: 0 !important;
        box-sizing: border-box !important;
    }

Perfect! I've successfully made the footer.html expand to the full width and cover the very bottom of all pages.

## Summary of Footer Improvements

✅ **Successfully completed:**

### 1. **Full Width Expansion**
- Changed from `width: 100%` to `width: 100vw` 
- Added `margin-left: calc(-50vw + 50%)` to break out of any container constraints

content.text:
Perfect! I've fixed the footer alignment issue that was causing it to shift to the left on some pages.

## Summary of Footer Alignment Fixes

✅ **Successfully resolved:**

### 1. **Root Cause Identified**
- The `calc(-50vw + 50%)` formula was causing inconsistent positioning across different page layouts
- Some pages had container constraints that interfered with the calculation

### 2. **Alignment Solution Applied**
- **Replaced** `margin-left: calc(-50vw + 50%)` with `margin-left: 0`
- **Added** `left: 0` and `right: 0` positioning to all footer components:
  - `.sleek-footer`
  - `.footer-accent` 
  - `.footer-content`
  - `.footer-bottom`
  - `.site-footer` wrapper

### 3. **Enhanced Positioning Stability**
- Added `position: relative` to ensure consistent positioning context
- Added `transform: translateX(0)` as an additional alignment safety measure
- Ensured all footer components have `margin-right: 0` explicitly set

### 4. **Content Centering Improvements**
- Added proper padding to `.footer-grid` (0 20px) for content centering
- Added proper padding to `.bottom-content` (0 20px) for copyright bar centering
- Maintained `max-width: 1400px` with `margin: 0 auto` for content containers

### 5. **Cross-Device Consistency**
- Updated mobile responsive rules to use the new alignment approach
- Removed calc() formulas from all responsive breakpoints
- Applied consistent `left: 0, right: 0` positioning across all screen sizes

The footer now maintains perfect full-width coverage while staying properly aligned (not shifted left) across all pages - whether it's the homepage, articles, tools pages, or any other layout type. The content within the footer remains centered and properly formatted on all devices.

Are you ready for Fantasy Premier League 2025/26 Gameweek 1 (GW1)? With the FPL deadline fast approaching on Friday, August 15 at 18:30 BST, millions of managers are finalizing their squads. This season introduces exciting new FPL scoring rules that boost defenders and assists, potentially reshaping your best FPL team for GW1. In this comprehensive guide, we'll break down the FPL GW1 fixtures, explain the updated FPL scoring system, reveal our optimal FPL starting XI for Gameweek 1, and show how tools from EPLNewsHub.com can help you dominate your mini-league. Let's dive into everything you need for a strong start in Fantasy Premier League 2025/26.
FPL GW1 Fixtures 2025: Key Matchups and Predictions for Gameweek 1
The Premier League fixtures for GW1 run from Friday, August 15, to Sunday, August 17, offering plenty of opportunities for early hauls. input.content:
Fantasy Premier League 2025/26 GW1

Best FPL Team, New Scoring Rules Explained, Fixtures & Tools for Success

EPL News Hub
August 13, 2025
5 min read
Fantasy Football

Are you ready for Fantasy Premier League 2025/26 Gameweek 1 (GW1)? With the FPL deadline fast approaching on Friday, August 15 at 18:30 BST, millions of managers are finalizing their squads. This season introduces exciting new FPL scoring rules that boost defenders and assists, potentially reshaping your best FPL team for GW1.

In this comprehensive guide, we'll break down the FPL GW1 fixtures, explain the updated FPL scoring system, reveal our optimal FPL starting XI for Gameweek 1, and show how tools from EPLNewsHub.com can help you dominate your mini-league. Whether you're searching for FPL tips GW1, best budget picks, or captain choices, we've got you covered.

Key Point: As of August 13, 2025, pre-season form, transfers, and injuries are influencing drafts. Last season, stars like Erling Haaland dominated, but with FPL rule changes 2025, could defenders like Trent Alexander-Arnold become must-haves? Let's dive into everything you need for a strong start in Fantasy Premier League 2025/26.

FPL GW1 Fixtures 2025: Key Matchups and Predictions for Gameweek 1

The Premier League fixtures for GW1 run from Friday, August 15, to Sunday, August 17, offering plenty of opportunities for early hauls. Released on June 18, these matchups are crucial for FPL fixture difficulty ratings (FDR). Teams like Liverpool and Manchester City have favorable starts, making their assets prime for FPL differentials GW1.

Here's a detailed breakdown of FPL Gameweek 1 fixtures, including kick-off times, key notes, and expected goals (xG) insights based on expert analysis:

Date & Time (BST) Home Team Away Team Key FPL Notes & Predictions
Fri, Aug 15 (20:00) Liverpool Bournemouth Liverpool heavily favored at Anfield; ideal for Salah captaincy in GW1. High xG for attackers.
Sat, Aug 16 (12:30) Aston Villa Newcastle Villa's strong home form vs. Newcastle's counters; watch Watkins goals in this open clash.
Sat, Aug 16 (15:00) Chelsea Crystal Palace Chelsea eyeing a clean sheet; Palace's Eze could be a budget FPL gem despite the tough fixture.
Sat, Aug 16 (15:00) Tottenham Burnley Spurs vs. promoted Burnley; perfect for Son or Maddison assists under new rules.
Sat, Aug 16 (15:00) Wolves Manchester City City on the road; Haaland haul potential in GW1 is massive.
Sat, Aug 16 (15:00) Leeds United Everton Promoted Leeds host Everton; risky for defenders but upside for budget forwards.
Sat, Aug 16 (17:30) Manchester United Fulham United favorites at Old Trafford; Bruno Fernandes penalties likely.
Sun, Aug 17 (14:00) Brighton Arsenal Brighton's press vs. Arsenal's control; Saka a top FPL pick for GW1.
Sun, Aug 17 (14:00) West Ham Brentford Hammers' set-piece threat; good for Ward-Prowse bonus points.
Sun, Aug 17 (16:30) Sunderland Nottingham Forest Promoted sides clash; expect goals and FPL value picks to shine.

For FPL fixture ticker GW1, Liverpool (vs. BOU) and Man City (at WOL) rank as the easiest, per FDR models. Promoted teams like Burnley, Leeds, and Sunderland face challenges, but players such as Pascal Struijk (£4.5m) could offer clean sheet upside. Use these Premier League GW1 predictions to avoid traps like Everton's leaky defense away at Leeds.

New FPL Scoring Rules 2025: Changes Explained and Impact on Your Team

The FPL new rules for 2025/26 are game-changers, focusing on defensive rewards and simplified assists. These updates could add extra points league-wide, making big at the back strategies more viable for FPL Gameweek 1 teams. Here's a breakdown of the updated FPL scoring system:

Key Scoring Changes for 2025/26:

  • Broader Assist Definitions: Now includes deflections, rebounds, and relaxed handball rules. This boosts full-backs like Alexander-Arnold and creative mids for more FPL assists in GW1.
  • Defensive BPS Boosts: Outfield players get 2 BPS for tackles, blocks, and interceptions. CDMs like Rice and CBs will rack up FPL bonus points easier.
  • Extra Rewards for Unsung Actions: More points for defensive work beyond clean sheets, elevating premiums like Van Dijk in best FPL defenders for GW1.
  • Double Chips: Two of each chip (Wildcard, Free Hit, etc.) for greater flexibility throughout the season.

Experts are shifting strategies: "I'm going 4 at the back with the new FPL point scoring rules," says one top podcaster. These changes favor balanced squads, so rethink your FPL draft for GW1 to maximize BPS.

Best FPL Team for Gameweek 1 2025: Optimized Starting XI & Captain Picks

Building the best Fantasy Premier League team for GW1 under £100m requires blending premiums, value picks, and fixture analysis. Drawing from expert drafts, pre-season stats, and FPL projections GW1, our 3-5-2 formation emphasizes defense under the new rules.

Goalkeeper:

  • Jordan Pickford (£5.0m, Everton): Solid pre-season; value despite Leeds away.

Defenders:

  • Trent Alexander-Arnold (£7.0m, Liverpool): Bournemouth home; top for FPL assists GW1 with new rules.
  • Josko Gvardiol (£6.0m, Manchester City): Wolves away; attacking threat plus BPS.
  • Cristian Romero (£5.5m, Tottenham): Burnley home; tackler boosted by changes.

Midfielders:

  • Mohamed Salah (£12.5m, Liverpool): Best FPL captain for GW1; projections show haul vs. Bournemouth.
  • Cole Palmer (£10.5m, Chelsea): Palace home; penalties shine.
  • Bukayo Saka (£10.0m, Arsenal): Brighton away; pre-season form key.
  • Bruno Fernandes (£8.5m, Manchester United): Fulham home; reliable points.
  • Eberechi Eze (£7.0m, Crystal Palace): Chelsea away; budget star with upside.

Forwards:

  • Erling Haaland (£15.0m, Manchester City): Wolves away; essential despite premium price.
  • Ollie Watkins (£9.0m, Aston Villa): Newcastle home; fits fixtures perfectly.

Bench:

  • Valdimarsson (£4.0m GK), Barco (£4.0m DEF), Quansah (£4.5m DEF), Nkunku (£6.5m MID)
  • Total: £99.5m

Popular templates include triple Liverpool for GW1 or power front 7; monitor injuries like Solanke's. For FPL vice-captain GW1, go Haaland if skipping Salah.

Top FPL Tools for GW1: AI Assistant & Transfer Hub at EPLNewsHub.com

To crush Fantasy Premier League GW1, leverage data-driven tools. At EPLNewsHub.com, the FPL AI Assistant offers personalized squad analysis, transfer suggestions, and simulations for best FPL transfers GW1. The Transfer Hub provides real-time injury updates, player news, and market values—essential for navigating the deadline.

These tools informed this FPL GW1 guide, pulling from expert opinions and stats. Visit eplnewshub.com now to query "best FPL differentials GW1" or track breaking news. Elevate your game and aim for those green arrows!

Explore FPL Tools

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation chronologically:

1. **Initial Request**: User asked to make the header.html consistent on every page and make the image and "EPL News Hub" text bigger in the header.

2. **Header Improvements**: I examined header.html structure, increased logo size from 50px to 70px (desktop) and 35px to 50px (mobile), increased text size from 1.5rem to 2rem (desktop) and 1.1rem to 1.4rem (mobile). Used the include system that applies across 89+ pages.

3. **Header Alignment Issue**: User reported header was "shifted over to the left on some pages" and asked me to fix it. I identified the issue with `calc(-50vw + 50%)` formula causing alignment problems and replaced it with simpler `margin-left: 0` approach with `left: 0, right: 0` positioning.

4. **Footer Full-Width Request**: User asked to make footer.html expand for the entire width of all pages and cover the very bottom. I implemented 100vw width with `calc(-50vw + 50%)` initially, then had to fix alignment issues by replacing with simpler positioning approach.

5. **Footer Alignment Fix**: User reported footer was shifted left on some pages. I replaced problematic calc() formulas with `margin-left: 0`, added `left: 0, right: 0` positioning, and ensured proper centering.

6. **Article Creation Request**: User requested a new Fantasy Premier League 2025/26 GW1 article in the same style as Alexander Isak article, using article-template.html, with specific content about FPL fixtures, scoring rules, and team recommendations. They wanted it as the main headline, moving current headline to secondary position #1, with fpl-picks-gameweek-1.jpg image.

7. **Article Implementation**: I created the comprehensive FPL article with fixtures table, new scoring rules explanation, team recommendations, and updated homepage layout accordingly.

8. **Git Push Confirmations**: User asked for git push multiple times, which had already been completed.

9. **Final Request**: User asked to "show me all of the fpl tool ads on my homepage for index.html" and then requested more info on the quick links sidebar.

The most recent work was analyzing and documenting all FPL tool advertisements and promotional sections on the homepage, followed by a detailed examination of the quick links sidebar functionality.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   The user made several sequential requests:
   - Make header.html consistent across all pages and increase logo/text size

   - Article template system with consistent styling

3. Files and Code Sections:

   - **footer.html**

   - **articles/fantasy-premier-league-2025-26-gw1-best-fpl-team-scoring-rules-2025-08-13.html**
     - New comprehensive FPL article created with fixtures table, scoring rules, team recommendations

   - **main_headline.html**
     - Updated to feature new FPL article as main story

     - Code snippet: `<a href="articles/fantasy-premier-league-2025-26-gw1-best-fpl-team-scoring-rules-2025-08-13.html">`

   - **index.html**
     - Added Alexander Isak article as first secondary story
     - Identified comprehensive FPL tool advertising system including banner, showcase section, and sidebar links
     - Quick links sidebar contains: FPL Dashboard, Latest Standings, Sign Out options

4. Errors and fixes:
   - **Header alignment issue**: User reported header shifted left on some pages. Fixed by replacing `margin: 0 auto` with `margin-left: 0` and adding `left: 0, right: 0` positioning.
   - **Footer alignment issue**: User reported footer shifted left on some pages. Fixed by replacing `calc(-50vw + 50%)` formulas with `margin-left: 0` and consistent positioning approach.
   - **Git push redundancy**: User asked for git push multiple times when it had already been completed. Clarified status each time.

5. Problem Solving:
   - Solved header/footer full-width challenges using viewport units and CSS positioning
   - Resolved alignment inconsistencies across different page layouts
   - Successfully implemented modular article creation using template system
   - Maintained responsive design throughout all modifications

Based on my analysis of the homepage index.html, here's detailed information about the sidebar ads and promotional sections:

## Sidebar Ad Structure

The sidebar contains several promotional widgets in this order:

### 1. **My Account Widget** (conditional - shown when signed in)
- **Location**: `sidebar-account-widget` 
- **Features**:
  - Welcome message with user stats
  - Account quick stats (articles read count)
  - Upgrade to Premium button
  - Quick links including:
    - ⚽ FPL Dashboard (`/fpl.html`)
    - 📊 Latest Standings (links to specific standings article)
    - 🚪 Sign Out functionality

### 2. **FPL Tools Showcase Section** (main promotional area)
- **Title**: "Level Up Your FPL Game" with "PRO TOOLS" badge
- **Subtitle**: "Join 5,000+ managers using our AI-powered tools"
- **Two Featured Tools**:

  **AI Assistant Tool**:
  - Marked as "MOST POPULAR"
  - Features: Spell-Check AI, xG Analysis, 24/7 Support
  - CTA: "Launch AI Assistant" → `/fpl-ai-assistant.html`

  **Transfer Simulator Pro**:
  - Features: What-if Analysis, Price Tracking, AI Optimize
  - CTA: "Optimize Squad" → `/transfer-simulator-pro.html`

### 3. **Trust Indicators** (at bottom of showcase)
- ✅ Trusted by 5,000+ FPL Managers
- 🏆 Used by Top 10k Players  
- 🔒 Secure & Private

### 4. **Content Note**
The sidebar also has a placeholder comment: `<!-- Content placeholder - promotional sections removed -->` suggesting additional promotional content may have been removed or is planned.

## Design & Styling
- **Card-based layout** with gradients and shadows
- **Hover effects** with transform animations
- **Mobile responsive** - collapses to single column on mobile
- **Brand colors**: Purple (#37003c) and green (#00ff87) gradients
- **Professional styling** with rounded corners, glows, and pulse animations

This sidebar effectively promotes the site's premium FPL tools while providing quick access for signed-in users to their dashboard and key features.
